com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplb

Class PPLB_TextUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplb.PPLB_TextUtil

  • public class PPLB_TextUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods for text-related programs of the PPLB emulator. This class is used in PPLB class.

    • Constructor Summary

      This is the constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • printText

        public final void printText(int x,
                            int y,
                            PPLBOrient orient,
                            PPLBFont font,
                            int widthMultiple,
                            int heightMultiple,
                            boolean reverseImage,
                            byte[] data)
                     throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                            BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to print the string and specify the internal font or soft font inside the printer for printing.
        Parameters:
        x - [in] X-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        y - [in] Y-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        orient - [in] Print orientation. Use PPLBOrient enum to set up.
        font - [in] Select font. The two types are internal font and soft font; Use PPLBFont enum to set up.
        widthMultiple - [in] The multiple of the character width. Range: 1~25 times.
        heightMultiple - [in] The multiple of the character length. Range: 1~25 times.
        reverseImage - [in] Whether the graphics are reversed. 'true' means to reverse the graphics; 'false' means normal.
        data - [in] String to print. Data type: byte array.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error.
        See Also:
        PPLBOrient, PPLBFont

      • printText

        public final void printText(int x,
                            int y,
                            PPLBOrient orient,
                            PPLBFont font,
                            int widthMultiple,
                            int heightMultiple,
                            boolean reverseImage,
                            java.lang.String variableName)
                     throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                            BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to print the string and specify the internal font or soft font inside the printer for printing.
        Parameters:
        x - [in] X-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        y - [in] Y-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        orient - [in] Print orientation. Use PPLBOrient enum to set up.
        font - [in] Select font. The two types are internal font and soft font; Use PPLBFont enum to set up.
        widthMultiple - [in] The multiple of the character width. Range: 1~25 times.
        heightMultiple - [in] The multiple of the character length. Range: 1~25 times.
        reverseImage - [in] Whether the graphics are reversed. 'true' means to reverse the graphics; 'false' means normal.
        variableName - [in] 'Variable' name or 'Counter' name.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error.
        See Also:
        PPLBOrient, PPLBFont, PPLB_FormUtil.setVariable(java.lang.String, int, com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplb.PPLBFieldJustification, java.lang.String), PPLB_FormUtil.setCounter(java.lang.String, int, com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplb.PPLBFieldJustification, int, java.lang.String)

      • storeTextGraphic

        public final void storeTextGraphic(android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                   int fontsize,
                                   boolean useBold,
                                   boolean useItalic,
                                   boolean useUnderline,
                                   boolean useStrikeout,
                                   java.lang.String imagename,
                                   java.lang.String data)
                            throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                                   BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to download the text graphic converted from the system font, and store the graphic into the printer.
        Parameters:
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        imagename - [in] The graphic name to save. Range: 1~8 alphanumeric (alphabets or numbers) characters.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error, or generating graphic data failed.

        This function only save the graphic data, and store the content into the printer's storage device. If need to print, please call PPLB_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic.

        As Flash memory has a limited access lifespan, unless graphic data is to be repeatedly used, it is recommended to store the graphic in DRAM.

        See Also:
        PPLB_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic(int, int, java.lang.String), PPLB_SetUtil.setStorage(com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplb.PPLBStorage)

      • storeTextGraphic

        public final void storeTextGraphic(android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                   int fontsize,
                                   boolean useBold,
                                   boolean useItalic,
                                   boolean useUnderline,
                                   boolean useStrikeout,
                                   java.lang.String imagename,
                                   java.lang.String data,
                                   PPLBOrient orient,
                                   int width)
                            throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                                   BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to download the text graphic converted from the system font, and store the graphic into the printer.
        Parameters:
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        imagename - [in] The graphic name to save. Range: 1~8 alphanumeric (alphabets or numbers) characters.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        orient - [in] Print orientation. Use PPLBOrient enum to set up.
        width - [in] User-defined width. Range: >= 0; 0 means the system automatically calculates the width.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error, or generating graphic data failed.

        This function only save the graphic data, and store the content into the printer's storage device. If need to print, please call PPLB_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic.

        As Flash memory has a limited access lifespan, unless graphic data is to be repeatedly used, it is recommended to store the graphic in DRAM.

        See Also:
        PPLB_GraphicsUtil.printStoreGraphic(int, int, java.lang.String), PPLB_SetUtil.setStorage(com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplb.PPLBStorage), PPLBOrient

      • printTextGraphic

        public final void printTextGraphic(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                   int fontsize,
                                   boolean useBold,
                                   boolean useItalic,
                                   boolean useUnderline,
                                   boolean useStrikeout,
                                   java.lang.String data,
                                   PPLBOrient orient,
                                   int width)
                            throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                                   BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to directly print text graphics converted using system fonts.
        Parameters:
        x - [in] X-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        y - [in] Y-axis coordinate. Range: 0~32000; unit: pixels.
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        orient - [in] Print orientation. Use PPLBOrient enum to set up.
        width - [in] User-defined width. Range: >= 0; 0 means the system automatically calculates the width.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error, or generating graphic data failed.
        See Also:
        PPLBOrient
